recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti and Meatballs
recipes.method:
1. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, Parmesan cheese, egg, and garlic. Mix well and form into meatballs.
2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add meatballs and cook until browned on all sides.
3. Reduce heat to low and add your favorite spaghetti sauce. Cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes, or until meatballs are cooked through.
4. Serve over cooked spaghetti and enjoy!

recipes.name: Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced
recipes.method:
1. In a large bowl, combine chicken, peppers, onion, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
2. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Add chicken mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
3. Serve with warm tortillas and your favorite toppings, such as salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.

recipes.name: Roasted Garlic Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: 2 lbs Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and diced
recipes.method:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut off the top of the garlic head, drizzle with olive oil, wrap in foil, and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until tender.
2. Meanwhile, boil potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain.
3. In a large bowl, mash potatoes and roasted garlic together. Add milk and butter, and continue mashing until desired consistency is reached.
4. Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Grilled Lemon Herb Chicken
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, rosemary, thyme, garlic, salt, and pepper.
2. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over chicken. Seal bag and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 24 hours.
3. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Remove chicken from marinade and discard remaining marinade.
4. Grill chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Pork Tenderloin
recipes.method:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Butterfly pork tenderloin by slicing it lengthwise down the middle, being careful not to cut all the way through.
2. In a small bowl, mix together spinach, feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, and olive oil. Spread mixture over inside of pork tenderloin.
3. Roll pork tenderloin back up and tie with kitchen twine to secure.
4. Season outside of pork tenderloin with salt and pepper.
5. Place pork tenderloin in a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 145°F.
6. Let pork tenderloin rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Creamy Garlic Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
recipes.method:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
2. While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
3. Add shrimp to skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until pink and cooked through. Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
4. Add heavy cream to skillet and bring to a simmer. Add Parmesan cheese and stir until melted.
5. Return shrimp to skillet and add cooked spaghetti. Toss everything together until well coated in sauce.
6. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Serve garnished with chopped parsley.
